definitions: (in the Roman Catholic Church) the official admission of a dead person into sainthood

examples.text: many parishioners wanted to attend church specifically to honor the canonization of Mother Teresa

shortDefinitions: official admission of dead person into sainthood

definitions: the treatment of someone or something as being above reproach or of great significance

examples.text: no sooner had he resigned than the process of his canonization began
the canonization of baby boomer culture

shortDefinitions: treatment of something as being above reproach

definitions: admission into a canon of literary or artistic works

examples.text: Joyce saw all that was wrong with literary canonization long before it happened to him
this swift canonization indicates the extent to which critics felt that the film was a revolutionary work in the history of cinema

shortDefinitions: admission into literary or artistic canon
